positive.review: So I had this game on disk, and probably have 5k hours in total, This game NEEDS a remaster so we can have multithreaded support so this game can last another 100 years
Yes I would recommend this game. It might be old, but active modders keep it alove.

Empire at War is a charming, janky, somewhat simplistic RTS from the golden age of Star Wars video games. 

Compared to the main RTS games of its day like Command and Conquer (The developers, Petroglyph, were former Westwood employees) the game is somewhat simplistic and small scale, with max unit limits, no tactical base building and active resource gathering, and a fairly strict rock-paper-scissors approach to gameplay. 

The campaigns are charming, especially the buck-wild Forces of Corruption campaign, but the real draw is the freeform Galactic Conquest mode that offers the greatest scope and depth. 

Luckily, there are a number of ambitious total conversion mods that completely overhaul the game. Few people nowadays play the base game - everyone is playing their flavor of mod, where it's huge unit and map packs, gameplay refinements, scope increase, total conversions to other eras or sci fi universes, makeover into a 4X Lite, etc. 

The biggest drawback is that as an old game in a to my knowledge no longer used engine, the game is jank and only grows more janky with time passing and mod functions slapped on top of it. Corrupted saves and crashes are the price to pay if you wanna get into the larger mods, and I have seen some strange bugs in my years of playing this game modded.

As a standalone game, it is pretty fun, but not worth 20 bucks or whatever the standard price. Luckily, as an old game it often goes on sale for less than 5 bucks. Get it on a discount. 

But the mods alone make this a must-have inclusion in any SW or RTS fan's library.

It holds up surprisingly well. Space battles are peak cinema.

You will get your enjoyment out of this one way or another. If you don't like certain aspects (ground fights are some hell version of rock-paper-scissors for me (skill issue)), other will make you fall in love.

This game refuses to die, rightfully slow. Despite it being ancient, modders have managed to use the base platform to create a game which still holds up to this day. I came back to it recently to get my Star Wars fix - it's nice to have a Star Wars game that hasn't been EA-ified. Sure there are things which would be nice to have, and the pathing's a bit janky, but ultimately they're two drops of water compared to an ocean of positivity. The vanilla game itself is worth a play, but the overhaul mods are where the experience really shines.

I have always been a fan of Star Wars and by chance I happened upon 'Corey Loses' on Youtube which brought me to this game. I love FoTR and mostly play that since I find the base game/FOC to be kinda unplayable after FoTR and Thrawns Revenge. I wish that all of the code would be released so Developers would have greater flexibility with what they can do with the game, but I am content with the lore and Submods! 

Base Game = 3/10
FOC = 5/10
FoTR = 9.5/10
Thrawns Revenge = 8.5/10

I bought the game on release day and celebrated the release of the expansion later that same year in 2006.
After Rebellion (1998), Force Commander, and Battlegrounds, finally a game to my liking with the potential of hundreds (or thousands)of 'wasted' hours. After only a short time, I started modifying the game by myself and discovered how easy it was and how promising the community was getting.
Within a short time, there were tons of mods of various franchises, and I started not just to like the game, but to love it. A very big thank you towards the team of Pegasus Chronicles!
Around 2015 or 2016, due to my life situation (and a fuckin' war), I lost my interest in computer games and the game was (briefly) forgotten to me...
This year (2025) I rediscovered the game /after buying it AGAIN on steam since I no longer have a DVD drive on my laptop...)and it hooked me again within seconds...
I sincerely hope that one day there will be a worthy spiritual successor of that game.
Absurd mod support, fun gameplay, space/ground combat feel the same and different, galaxy map provides great level of strategy.
The Only Star Wars RTS u need to buy. MOD support is insanely active. Updates are still pushed even for an old game. 10/10

A game that still holds up despite being almost 20 years old, you might need some quick thinking and/or prior RTS knowledge so you don't get overwhelmed at first, but once you get past that hurdle you'll have a fun time.

Also this game has some really good workshop mods, which is something I love seeing in a game.
Great game. All time classic and great comfort game.

I honestly forgot I could even write a review here.

This game is fantastic. The mods keep breathing new life into it, bringing more variety and so many different ways to play. This is how you keep a game alive: small careful patches over the years that almost never caused issues for mods.

Not like certain other companies out there, right Mr. Howard? Wellâ€¦

Empire at War remains a masterpiece, kept alive by its community and still worth every minute.

Despite being so old I keep coming back to this game. It's almost the perfect strategy game for Star Wars and the modding community helps to keep it alive. I really hope someone will go out and make a second game but until then I'll just keep playing this one.

Found this game due to Captain Shack from xpgamers.
The base game is pretty good but the mods make this game dang near beyond compare. The rumors for a total war star wars has me excited only cause i can see a modern engine version of this game isreally all they need. 10/10 has me coming back to steam roll the galaxy as the evil empire or freeing it as the heroic rebellion day after day.

By far one of the most fun Star Wars RTS titles that'll ever be made. By far yes obviously it is old, however, mods make it this little gem into the hardest and shiniest diamonds and gem out there. 10/10 would recommend any fan of Star Wars or rts to play...

The Modding Community Breaths such rich life into this 21 year old game. You should honestly get the this game for the mods alone. It is easily the best RTS star was game of all time. However, make sure you have a strong computer to play it. It can be rather slow at times, if your computer can't handle two much happening at once.
Great game, allows you to control planets and build fleets. It's sort of like Age of Empires with space battles too.
I fucking love this game,if you are a fan of strategy games and star wars this is peak,a bit outdated but still very much worth it
very fun game but make a only space battles gamemode
An old game with not updates, but that's not the important thing. The thing that I love about this game it is the community putting effort and love in making mods that everyone can play.
Greatest Star Wars RTS game ever made. Not to mention number of mods created by dedicated community. If you like Star Wars universe, you should definitely give it a shot.
have actually played many more hours over the years. it will always be one of the best games i have ever played.
This game is perfect for anyone who wants to control entire Star destroyers and turn the galaxy's fate into your hands!

Despite being dated modders keep this game alive
If they made a starwars game like this today it would be quite popular
Very good game for those who like star wars, 10/10 i would recommend people get it, in my opinion it is worth the $20
Absolutely fantastic modded. Each popular mod redefines the game as a whole and would deserve it's own review. Absolutely worth it.
I love strategy games and I love star wars and when you add mods the game becomes 100x better.
Great game, visually really captures the cinematic feel

It's a bit old, a bit clunky, and occasionally buggy, but that doesn't subtract from the fun. Whether playing the base game or one of the many incredible mods for the game, it offers an authentic experience of fighting as a commander in the Star Wars universe. While the graphics and mechanics may not have kept up with the times very well, the gameplay itself and the story of the campaigns bring a lot of fun for playing it through time after time. Add to that a multiplayer mode as well, and this game promises endless hours of enjoyment.
Base game - good. Mods - incredible. 20+ year old game and it still hits that rts itch

Good old game.  Has a decent story line and graphics.  Both strategic and tactical, can do single space or ground battles or long term combined campaigns, and has optional objective to receive extra forces or funds.  This is only Empire At War, and not the other alternate Force of Corruption game as the original Gold Pack.
playing as CIWS is wayyy easier than i thought it would be even on single planet start just stack a bunch of tie-(i forgor) and destroy all with just hundreds of squads of those
Great game tons of fun and great mods to make the game better

I deeply enjoy the Galactic Conquest modes in the Battlefront games, so this game being that with more focus on galaxy wide battles both space and land is so I have a confession and I want you to take me serious. I cannot hold this information within myself any longer because it cripples me everyday being the only one bearing it's weight. I killed three men one night on March 23rd 2009 at a local mom and pop shop in a secluded and rural part of town. for the sake of the owners of said shop and few residents surrounding I will not be disclosing any specific locations. As I was walking into the shop for groceries, one of the three men had approached me to bum a cigarette, I politely declined as I do not smoke. he seemed ill at the denial, but walked away back to the other two men. They all looked back at me with crude stares, like they were disgusted at me for having self discipline, I thought nothing of it so I went into the store to fetch groceries as I had planned to do. When I came back out, the three men grouped up tightly and followed me to my car. While I was loading my groceries, one goes to swing at me and I move out of the way just in time. I then exploded them all with my mind and flew away.
I stabbed a homeless man, got online, and cosplayed as the Sith Empire in a mod. 10/10.
yes a classic rts starwars and a must have on my list!  and iv ben gaming since green screen
It was a great game and the mod community has made it legendary!
Classic strategy within the Star Wars Universe...very entertaining!
The closest thing to a star wars sandbox you can get. I highly recommend the Awakening of the Rebellion mod and Thrawn's Revenge
the mod i play thrawans revenge is incredibly well done and keeps me entertained for hours
With a fuck ton of Ton-Falks, anything is possible.
Played this as a kid 15 years ago, found it here and my childhood memories came back!
Good strategy game for us nerds.

This game is an interesting beast to describe. The space combat that people love from Homeworld, the ground combat that tastes of later games like Halo Wars, and what's this? Mod-compatible via steam?
Let me be blunt: Enough people have reviewed the base game, so let me just say that when you buy this game you're buying a LOT of games with all the total conversion mods and if there's some tiny little thing you just don't like then rest assured that someone did something about it.
Sure, there are bugs and limitations, but for the forgettable price I paid I got more than enough to justify this purchase.

If you are a military strategist and/or star wars enthusiast, this game is for you. I love the strategy behind choices, both for money and power. The mod extensions all work very well, and are a definite part of this game.

Insanely PEAK game for its age! Needs a Remaster STAT!!

Really fun to do space battles and conquest modes :D

Its simple, easy to run, and generally fun. It's not going to take up all your brain power to play, and it probably won't become your favorite game. But the fact is, it's solid, and for a few hours every know-and-then, it's perfect.
It's an old game but still fun to play.
Have had this since it originally came out on disk. Switched to Steam when the disk stopped working. The mods have really allowed this to stand even after all these years. The FOC campaign is great.
It's 2025, and EAW FOC is still the best RTS out there.
Played with friends as a kid, still fun.
super fun but the movement of the bigger capital ships can be irritating sometimes
fun realistic battles worth every hour
Sadly cant sex the gungans (good game tho)
I love to destroy aliens for the empire
Base game is good, with mods it's even better.
all of my hours have been spent playing corey loses mods. shoutout my boy corey
best SW game iv played love Everything about this
if i call an RTS good them it must be pretty fukin good
this is the most fun RTS game ever it really needs a Sequel
best game ever i swear i put my halloween candy on it
i love this game been playing it on and off since im a kid
Best star wars RTS thats been made the mods are amazing to
Certified hood classic
its fun with mods

THE MODS THE MODS
SO MANY GOOD MODS
i love star wars and this game lets feel that
me like star wars, me like game
Best Star Wars RTS ever made
One of the best RTS games ever made.
the best star wars RTS
Captures the feel of Star Wars very well
Best Star Wars RTS Game I've Seen To Date
very fun and lots of good mods :)
Solid mods, never played the base game.
Its pretty good
bit laggy but a fun game

actually really fun

a must play for star wars fans

negative.review: Was going fine initially then hit a glitch on Mission 3 of the Rebel Campaign that seems unrecoverable. GGame is likely too odd to run on modern systems so cannot recommend.

It's an old game. That being said, the AI sucks. Never let the computer auto resolve anything. you will loose half (or more) of your forces for no reason. I am writing this because I have controlled Coruscant with full ground forces and a fleet above since I started a campaign. I Rebel fleet decided to attack the planet. When I went into the battle, guess what? I had to attack my own lvl 4 space station, satellites, and kill the invading forces. in fleet battles the AI gets over whelmed and the orders you give might be carried out, or not. And ships warn you of asteroids, but damn sure want to turn into them even though you keep turning them away. If you love star wars and want frustration, buy it.

There is certainly fun to be had in this game and the graphics in the space battles are really good considering the game's age and the sound effects are consistently perfec throughout, but the frenetic, real-time nature of the game is too much. struggling to juggle multiple things on the strategic map in real time is just too frenetic. And while the space battles are really fun, the controls are frustrating. There's no easy way to select the kinds of ships you want, so you find yourself, in real time, frantically trying to click on all the ships you want for a specific action while avoiding clicking on the ones you don't want to order. this is why I'll always prefer turn-based games
Bad game just bad and another of the day game
Games trash
okijnhyuf5rtde4
